qas.question: Who prompted Eritrea to be federated with Ethiopia in 1950?
Which UN Resolution called for Eritrea and Ethiopia to be linked via a loose federal structure under sovereignty of the Emperor?
What would federal government control in Eritrea according to Resolution 390A(V)??

answers.text: foreign affairs (including commerce), defense, finance, and transportation

qas.question: Which Eritrean wishes did Resolution 390A(V) ignore?
What did Resolution 390A(V) guarantee the population of Eritrea?

answers.text: democratic rights and a measure of autonomy

qas.question: What country was being led by an Emperor in 1950?
What Eritrean wishes did UN Resolution 390A(V) fulfill?
What UN Resolution was adopted in November 1950?
What rights did UN Resolution 390A(V) give to Ethiopians?

context: Following the adoption of UN Resolution <a1_0><b7_0>390A(V)<b7_0/><a1_0/> in December 1950, Eritrea was federated with Ethiopia under the prompting of <b5_0>the <a0_0>United States<b5_0/><a0_0/>. The resolution called for Eritrea and Ethiopia to be linked through a loose federal structure under the sovereignty of the Emperor. Eritrea was to have its own administrative and judicial structure, its own flag, and control over its domestic affairs, including police, local administration, and taxation. The federal government, which for all intents and purposes was the existing imperial government, was to control <a2_0>foreign affairs (including commerce), defense, finance, and transportation<a2_0/>. The resolution ignored the wishes of Eritreans for <a3_0><b6_0>independence<b6_0/><a3_0/>, but guaranteed the population <a4_0><b8_0>democratic<b8_0/> rights and a measure of autonomy<a4_0/>.
